"Dust walls. Survival math. "
"Sandstorm shelter tactics" means outsmarting a storm’s fury with speed and cover.

Sandstorms don’t announce themselves—they erupt. Winds hit 50 mph, hurling sand like tiny bullets. Your move? Drop, cover, seal.

First, find low ground. A ditch, a dry riverbed—anywhere wind flows over you, not through you. Like hiding under a table during an earthquake.
Next, cover your air. A scarf, shirt, or even your hands over nose/mouth—breathing sand burns lungs. Think of it as filtering coffee grounds from your drink.
If trapped in a vehicle, park, turn off AC, and seal vents. Engines suck in sand like vacuums, ruining filters. Wait it out.

Bedouins use tight-woven cloth to block sand while letting air pass. Modern preppers pack N95 masks + goggles—same idea, lab-tested.

Three related subjects are desert navigation tricks, improvised air filters, and flash flood escapes.
